meanings.definition: To place or set in the sky.
meanings.sent1: The kite was enskied high above the park.
meanings.sent2: The sun enskied the clouds with a golden hue.
meanings.sent3: The magician enskied the bird, making it disappear into the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams were enskied, reaching for the stars in the night.
meanings.sent5: The hot air balloon was enskied, floating gracefully in the sky.

meanings.definition: To elevate or exalt to the sky.
meanings.sent1: The angel enskied the souls of the departed to heaven.
meanings.sent2: The music enskied the audience, lifting their spirits.
meanings.sent3: The chef's delicious dish enskied our taste buds to cloud nine.
meanings.sent4: Her words enskied his heart, filling it with love and joy.
meanings.sent5: The cheers of the crowd enskied the victorious team to cloud nine.
